title: How Big a Deal Is Bruno Mars‚Äô ‚ÄòI Just Might‚Äô Becoming His First Single to Debut at No.¬†1?
summary: This week's Five Burning Questions looks at Bruno's explosive first-week performance for his 'The Romantic' lead single.
body: It’s been an insane 15-year run of hits for Bruno Mars in pop music, one that’s now accounted for a full 10 No. 1 hits on the Billboard Hot 100 . But of those 10, only one of them has debuted in the top spot: his latest, the funky new single “I Just Might.” “Might” ‚Äî which leads Mars’ upcoming The Romantic album, due out in late February ‚Äî bows atop the Hot 100 this week, taking over from Taylor Swift’s “The Fate of Ophelia.” Remarkably, it’s the pop superstar’s first lead single from a solo project in nearly a decade, since the 24K Magic title track in 2016. How big a deal is it for “Might” to debut atop the Hot 100? And where else would we like to see Mars go on his new album? Billboard staffers discuss these questions and more below. 1. Bruno Mars‚Äô ‚ÄúI Just Might‚Äù debuts at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100, dethroning Taylor Swift‚Äôs 10-week No. 1 ‚ÄúThe Fate of Ophelia.‚Äù On a scale of 1-10, how impressive an achievement is this for Bruno? Katie Atkinson:  10. And it‚Äôs his 10th Hot 100 chart-topper, and he dethroned a 10-week No. 1, so 10 is officially his magic number. Nothin‚Ä¶

title: These Official ‚ÄòKPop Demon Hunters‚Äô Water Bottles Help You Seal the Honmoon While Quenching Your¬†Thirst
summary: These water bottles are extremely afforable and cute to boot.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. The thirst for KPop Demon Hunters isn’t going away anytime soon. First released on Netflix last June, the film has won over audiences with its poppy, colorful visuals, loveable characters, and memorable chart-topping songs . The anthem-esque track “Golden” had a run of eight weeks at No. 1 on the multimetric Billboard Hot 100 , from mid-August through mid-October; 18 weeks atop the Billboard Global 200; and a record 20 weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard Global Excl. U.S. chart. Most impressive, the song is up for Song of the Year, Best Pop Duo/Group Performance and Best Song Written for Visual Media at the 2026 Grammys , not a small feat given the film has only been out for a little under eight months. Shoppers and retailers alike have also hopped aboard the Hunters train, with everything from official books to apparel and merch arriving online on the heels of the film’s success. title: Thalia to Cohost Premio Lo Nuestro 2026: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a Celebration of Our Music, Our¬†Roots‚Äô
summary: Dominican actress Clarissa Molina and Paraguayan model Nadia Ferreira are also cohosts of the ceremony.
body: Thalia is returning to the Premio Lo Nuestro stage as cohost alongside Dominican actress Clarissa Molina and Paraguayan model Nadia Ferreira. This will mark the Mexican actress‚Äô fourth time as cohost of the awards show. ‚ÄúPremio Lo Nuestro has been part of my story for many years, and returning to this stage as a host is something that fills me with excitement,‚Äù Thalia, who‚Äôs nominated for best female combination and Mexican music collaboration of the year, said in a statement. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a celebration of our music, our roots and the Latin talent that continues to shine on a global level.‚Äù Both Molina and Ferreira are also returning as hosts. The latter will make her awards ceremony cohosting debut after hosting the pre-show Noche de Estrellas in 2025. ‚ÄúI feel deeply honored to once again lead the hosting of Premio Lo Nuestro, a space I am truly passionate about and thoroughly enjoy,‚Äù Molina said in a statement. ‚ÄúCelebrating our music and culture each year from this stage is a reminder to never forget where we come from and to always feel proud of our Latin roots.‚Äù Bad Bunny, Car√≠n Le√≥n, Myke Towers and Rauw Alejandro lead the 2026 nominations with 10 mentions each. title: Fires Erupt in South-Central Chile
summary: Tens of thousands of people fled to safety as blazes spread throughout the country‚Äôs Biob√≠o and √ëuble regions.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Fires Erupt in South-Central‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us Search January 18, 2026 Wildland fires broke out amid hot and dry conditions in south-central Chile in mid-January 2026, prompting evacuations and causing extensive damage to infrastructure. As of January 20, the spate of deadly fires had burned more than 30,000 hectares (74,000 acres) in the country‚Äôs Biob√≠o and √ëuble regions, according to Chile‚Äôs National Forestry Corporation . The MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) instrument on NASA‚Äôs Terra satellite captured this image of smoke billowing from multiple fires on January 18. Dozens of active fires in the area prompted the evacuation of 50,000 people and destroyed more than 300 homes, according to a January 19 report from Chile‚Äôs U.N‚Ä¶
